newsitem.title: USA: Mexico's Ortiz sees GDP up at least 4.0 pct in '97.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Ortiz sees GDP up at least 4.0 pct in '97.

text.p: Mexican Finance Secretary Guillermo Ortiz said the market estimate of 4.0-percent Mexican economic growth for 1996 is "quite feasible."
Ortiz, speaking to a group of investment bankers here, also predicted 4.0 percent growth in 1997 but said he believes the 1997 forecast is a "conservative estimate."
Regarding the strong recent performance of Mexico's export industries, Ortiz said, "It appears export-led growth is sustainable."
Ortiz said he expects $8.0 billion in direct foreign investment in Mexico this year and a similar good showing in 1997.
"Next year looks quite substantial," Ortiz added.
However, despite a generally favorable economic outlook for Mexico in 1997, Ortiz said, "It will take some time to get the banking system on a solid footing."
